questions.question: What does 'var' do in JavaScript?
options: Declares a variable with global scope
Declares a variable with block scope
questions.answer: Declares a variable with global scope
questions.feedback: In JavaScript, 'var' declares a variable with global or function scope.

questions.question: Which method is used to add a new item to the end of an array?
questions.feedback: The push() method adds a new item to the end of an array.

questions.question:
What will the following code return?
console.log(typeof null);
questions.feedback: In JavaScript, 'typeof null' incorrectly returns 'object' due to a bug in the language.

questions.question: Explain the difference between == and === in JavaScript.
questions.answer: == checks for equality of values, while === checks for equality of both values and types.
questions.feedback: Use === for strict comparison in JavaScript to avoid unexpected type conversions.

questions.question:
What is the output of the following code?
console.log(1 + '1');
questions.feedback: In JavaScript, the + operator concatenates the string and number, so 1 + '1' results in '11'.
